verses.verse: Therefore the Jews of the villages who dwelt in the unwalled towns celebrated the fourteenth day of the month of Adar (Deut. 16:11, 14) with gladness and feasting, (Esth. 8:16, 17) as a holiday, and for (Neh. 8:10, 12; Esth. 9:22) sending presents to one another.
And Mordecai wrote these things and sent letters to all the Jews, near and far, who were in all the provinces of King Ahasuerus,
to establish among them that they should celebrate yearly the fourteenth and fifteenth days of the month of Adar,
